[LEXICON]: Occasionally archaic vocabulary (e.g., "trammelled," "lumbering") may slightly impede modern readability.
[SYNTAX]: Infrequent use of very long, complex sentence structures (e.g., first paragraph of Introduction) that marginally disrupt flow.

[TRANSITION]: Mild abruptness between the anecdotal Introduction and the broader artistic/historical context (e.g., shift to discussing Delacroix/David without explicit bridge).
[STRUCTURE]: Brief, tangential detail (e.g., description of fatherâ€™s shop environment) that, while thematic, slightly delays narrative progression.

[LEXICON]: Awkward phrasing ("generously paid for at five francs a meter")

[TRANSITION]: Slight disconnect between paragraphs (e.g., shift from Louvre to decorating fans)
